Milan discussing Gattuso status
There are growing reports Milan are considering Gennaro Gattuso’s status as Coach and could make a change after the defeat to Torino.

This evening’s 2-0 loss in Turin means the Rossoneri picked up only five points in the last seven Serie A rounds.

They crashed out of the Coppa Italia midweek to Lazio and slipped from fourth place down to sixth in Serie A, which will be seventh tomorrow if Atalanta get a result against Udinese.

Sky Sport Italia, La Gazzetta dello Sport and MilanNews.it are all reporting this evening that the club is giving serious thought to dismissing Gattuso.

There are only four rounds left in the Serie A season and as things stand, Milan risk not qualifying for Europe at all.

It’s reported directors Ivan Gazidis, Leonardo and Paolo Maldini were still locked in a meeting over 90 minutes after the final whistle, some of it spent with Gattuso.

It is also suggested Milan will not cancel the planned day off for the squad on Monday, which again points to a possible change of management.

Secondo quanto riportato da Il Messaggero, Marco Giampaolo, attuale allenatore della Sampdoria, è stato contattato nelle ultime settimane da due club: la Roma e il Milan. I giallorossi lo ritengono una sorta di opzione finale, nel caso in cui dovessero saltare le strade che portano a Conte, Sarri e Gasperini. Per quanto riguarda i rossoneri, le opzioni principali sono comunque altre, ma i contatti con il tecnico doriano ci sono stati perché c'è stima nei suoi confronti e nel tempo è una possibilità che potrebbe prendere corpo.

As reported by Il Messaggero, Marco Giampaolo, current coach of Sampdoria, has been contacted in the last few weeks by two clubs: Roma and Milan. The Giallorossi consider it a sort of final option, in case they should miss the roads leading to Conte, Sarri and Gasperini. As for the Rossoneri, the main options are still others, but there have been contacts with the coach because there is esteem for him and over time is a possibility that could take shape.

What a terrible game last night. While Gattuso is facing the heat, there are several players who also need to be given a kick up their backside and sold this summer. For me, that includes:

Suso - one dimensional, slow and bad attitude

Hakan - shows heart but just not good enough

Conti - terrible tactical awareness and indiscipline

Kessie - poor decision making and finishing, lack of competition has probably made him complacent

Biglia - could be a useful squad player but older and slower

Laxalt - not good enough for where we need to be and could fetch some money from a mid to lower table team like Bologna

Musacchio - commits several mistakes. Don't know if it's a confidence thing or if he's not able to read the game

This is in addition to Montolivo, Bertolacci and Mauri, who are expected to leave the club anyways.

Now the problem is that without CL and with FFP, it will be hard to sell players and replace them with better options.

I'm on the fence about Laxalt, Kessie, Musacchio and Biglia but there's no doubt in my mind about the other three. I also have Kessie on the list because we may have to sell him to buy Baka, who is a far better player imo.

How would you go about rebuilding the team, if you were Leonardo with a budget of (say) $50 to $70 million?

The meeting between Gennaro Gattuso and the Milan leadership has ended. The Rossoneri coach has just left the club's seat aboard a car. It was a usual meeting, like those that usually take place at Milanello when training starts again. The parties have been updated after yesterday evening, at the end of the championship match lost against Torino, a point was made of the situation. No change, just the desire to get out of a complicated period. At the end of the further confrontation, which lasted about an hour, it was decided not to adopt any "punitive" or anticipated withdrawal, as perhaps one could have feared. Gattuso, for his part, naturally did not take any steps back. The coach, after the meeting ended, left Casa Milan: here is the video.

Reports on Monday stated that Gennaro Gattuso will be sacked even if he guides the team to a now unlikely top four finish, with the team having accrued just five points from their last eight Serie A matches.

Mauricio Pochettino has been touted as a potential replacement for Gattuso, but could Max Allegri be a shock candidate too?

Allegri was a guest on ‘Che tempo che fa‘ recently and he was asked about him leaving Milan for Juventus. Allegri’s response was somewhat of a shock: “Now back to Milan. A couple of years and I’ll be back.”

While at Juventus, Allegri has lead the team to two Champions League final appearances and four Serie A titles in his four years at the club.

Allegri is widely regarded as one of the best managers in the world, and was of course the last Milan boss to lift the Scudetto as he did in the 2010-11 season.

Milan stand by Gattuso, consider EDF
Milan are reportedly sticking with Gennaro Gattuso until the end of the season after today’s summit, but evaluating Eusebio Di Francesco for next term.

Multiple sources all give the same version of events in today’s meeting at Casa Milan, which involved the Coach, directors Leonardo, Ivan Gazidis and Paolo Maldini.

It was decided that the club will stand by Gattuso until the end of the season, as there are only four rounds left in the Serie A campaign and they are out of the Coppa Italia.

The quartet discussed how to achieve the objective of fourth place in Serie A and agreed there would not be a training retreat for the squad.

The training regime will remain as it is.

However, Gattuso’s future may well be outside of Milan regardless of the results achieved in this final month.

According to Sport Mediaset, the club is evaluating former Roma and Sassuolo Coach Di Francesco for the role.

He could not be hired this season, as the rules in Italy bar tacticians from working for more than one club in the same league during one campaign.

Di Francesco was fired by Roma last month to bring in Claudio Ranieri as caretaker, but had taken them to the Champions League semi-final last year.

近7輪聯賽得5分，AC米蘭在意甲爭四戰失去了主導權，甚至以56分降至聯賽榜第7位，有機會連來季歐霸盃參賽資格都保不住。在不敵拖連奴2-0後，AC米蘭主教練加度素（Gennaro Gattuso）有可能失去帥印。意大利各大媒體報導，無論結果如何，他會在季尾離隊。

意大利媒體如Milan News、《全市場》（Tuttomercatoweb） 及Sport Mediaset 均報導，無論米蘭最終能否獲得前四，加度素都會離開。而根據Di Marzio的消息，在對拖連奴賽後米蘭曾經召開緊急高層會議，與會者包括加度素、總裁加斯迪斯（Ivan Gazidis）、技術總監李安納度（Leonardo）及足球策略發展總監馬甸尼（Paolo Maldini）。經討論後，加度素仍然留任。但根據各大媒體報道指，這只是因為高層目前尚未找到合適人選代替加度素。

根據《羅馬體育報》（Corriere dello Sport）報導，加度素和李安納度對於球隊戰術及用人鬧分歧。一手引進柏基達（Paqueta）的李安納度認為，這位巴西外援應該是4-3-1-2陣式裏位列雙箭頭身後的進攻中場，而不是4-3-3陣式裏的三中場；加度素堅持，雙翼查漢奴古（Calhanoglu）及蘇素（Suso）不可替換，球隊不應為柏基達的定位而改動體系。

米蘭主席史卡隆尼（Paolo Scaroni） 向Radio Anch’Io Sport表示：「最近幾個月球隊戰績不佳，狀態出現下滑。昨晚失利後，歐聯資格也離球隊漸行漸遠，但是我們並不會放棄。」「在競技層面，我不會做任何評論，因為我們有李安納度和馬甸尼這樣資深專業的人士，這是他們要關心的事情。我需要對他們保持尊重。」

「但毋庸置疑的是，與下屆歐聯絕緣會對我們的財政造成影響，也會讓我們之前的計劃放慢腳步。」「我們並沒有為打入歐聯而好好預算，我和所有球迷一樣很失望，但我們還是會盡最大的努力去實現我們的目標。」

米蘭官方宣佈，於對拖連奴的上半場第3分鐘時，干迪出現了左肩膀關節扭傷，經過隊醫的檢查和診斷後，證實非骨折，不過此次肩膀受傷被確認為是肩胛骨一級扭傷。接下來隊醫將對干迪的情況進行進一步檢查，預計將不能參加下週對博洛尼亞的賽事。

加上早前卡拉比拿需養傷2個月，米蘭現有右閘除了阿巴迪外還有波連尼。由於下場意甲賽事羅馬洛尼停賽的關係，預計若4後衛陣容將會是阿巴迪/梅沙基奧/薩柏達/列卡度洛迪古斯，若3後衛陣容將會起用卡達拿。

Scaroni: If Milan don't make CL...
Paolo Scaroni claims Milan ‘haven’t played well for months’ and warns of ‘economic’ implications if they do not make the Champions League.

A run of only one win in seven Serie A games has seen Milan fall out of the top four, in turn piling the pressure on Coach Gennaro Gattuso.

“We haven’t played well for months,” Scaroni told Radio Anch’io Sport.

“There’s been a drop in form. The Champions League has moved away from us after yesterday’s result, but we won’t give up.

“On purely sporting topics, I don’t want to make any comments because we have a technical area of Leonardo and Maldini, consisting of absolute respect.

“Missing out on the Champions League would mean an evident and immediate economic impact, plus a slowdown in us reaching our objectives.

“We didn’t budget for entry into the Champions League. All the fans and I are disappointed, but we’ll keep doing our utmost to achieve our objective.”

The President was then asked about the recent racism storm in Italian football, which saw Tiemoue Bakayoko and Franck Kessie targeted by Lazio fans.

“I think it’s a bit like that,” he replied when asked if fans had too much power on the peninsula.

“In England they’re way ahead of us. Often, however, someone goes in search of small incidents.

“I don’t want to dwell on this. I won’t judge the decision taken. We have a video where there are 32 racist chants and images with banana boats.

“It’s clear. If [authorities] wanted to see it and intervene, they could. Referee and assistants could also be vigilant because they could stop the game.

“I’m not saying they should abandon the game, they could suspend it but at least for a few minutes.

“We’ve always acted against these things. Our fans are absent from these phenomena of racism. Always, or at least recently.

“Certainly, with greater control of the stadium, we can intervene better.”

Costacurta reflects on 'high expectations' at Milan and reveals the flaws of club management
Interviewed by Corriere della Sera, the former AC Milan defender Alessandro Costacurta commented on the current situation at the club and the work done by Gennaro Gattuso.

"Gattuso himself said he was disappointed that he had failed to convey his way of thinking to the players. In my opinion, his communication strategy is studied. He has been in the locker room for a year and a half and he knows his men well," he said.

"There are few coaches in the world who can change the face of a team. 3-4 champions can change the balance of a team and, with all affection, Gattuso is not among them.

"We have to ask ourselves if his team is of greater value than that of Inter, Roma or Lazio. In my opinion, Milan has created high expectations. Milan seemed unable to withstand the pressure, from excessive euphoria to overwhelming depression.

"The management? In my opinion, the directors are too present. Leonardo, Maldini, Gazidis and Scaroni are bulky figures, with personalities that can be intimidating. They generate more anxiety than confidence," Costacurta concluded.

Billy 忍唔住
